title: assign_priors return value when zero ground truths
body:
Hi @lufficc 

I was trying to train on the custom dataset and many of the images have zero objects. In that case, how should I deal with [assign_priors()](https://github.com/lufficc/SSD/blob/50373c79b861d5d239be4206fafc6661cea040b4/ssd/utils/box_utils.py#L74) function? 

Normally it throws the following error because of zero gt_boxes.
```
Original Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/user/anaconda3/envs/pytorch-ssd-lfc/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/utils/data/_utils/worker.py", line 185, in _worker_loop
    data = fetcher.fetch(index)
  File "/home/user/anaconda3/envs/pytorch-ssd-lfc/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/utils/data/_utils/fetch.py", line 44, in fetch
    data = [self.dataset[idx] for idx in possibly_batched_index]
  File "/home/user/anaconda3/envs/pytorch-ssd-lfc/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/utils/data/_utils/fetch.py", line 44, in <listcomp>
    data = [self.dataset[idx] for idx in possibly_batched_index]
  File "/home/user/code/ssd-lufficc/ssd/data/datasets/bdd.py", line 123, in __getitem__
    boxes, category = self.target_transform(boxes, category)
  File "/home/user/code/ssd-lufficc/ssd/data/transforms/target_transform.py", line 22, in __call__
    self.corner_form_priors, self.iou_threshold)
  File "/home/user/code/ssd-lufficc/ssd/utils/box_utils.py", line 94, in assign_priors
    ious = iou_of(gt_boxes.unsqueeze(0), corner_form_priors.unsqueeze(1))
  File "/home/user/code/ssd-lufficc/ssd/utils/box_utils.py", line 65, in iou_of
    overlap_left_top = torch.max(boxes0[..., :2], boxes1[..., :2])
RuntimeError: The size of tensor a (0) must match the size of tensor b (2) at non-singleton dimension 2
```

To solve this problem,  I return corner_from_priors and labels (all zeros)  whenever gt_boxes are zero, as seen below.
```
def assign_priors(gt_boxes, gt_labels, corner_form_priors, iou_threshold):
    if (gt_boxes.shape[0]==0):
        return corner_form_priors, torch.zeros(corner_form_priors.max(1)[0].shape).type(torch.LongTensor)
    else:
        # size: num_priors x num_targets eg. torch.Size([8732, 7])
        ious = iou_of(gt_boxes.unsqueeze(0), corner_form_priors.unsqueeze(1))
    ......
    ......
```


Is this correct? Can I return the same priors? I can rais PR for this issue.
Thank you in advance.
